title: Security Audit and Hardening
description:
Security Audit and Vulnerability Remediation

Perform a comprehensive security assessment of the application and implement necessary hardening measures to protect against common vulnerabilities and attacks.

Requirements:
- Conduct thorough security audit covering:
  * Authentication and authorization mechanisms
  * Input validation and sanitization
  * API endpoint security and rate limiting
  * Dependency vulnerabilities (scan package.json/requirements.txt)
  * Secrets management and credential storage
  * CORS and CSP configurations
  * SQL injection and XSS attack vectors
  * CSRF protection implementation

- Document findings:
  * Categorize vulnerabilities by severity (Critical, High, Medium, Low)
  * Identify affected components and endpoints
  * Create prioritized remediation plan

- Implement security hardening:
  * Update vulnerable dependencies to patched versions
  * Add input validation and output encoding where missing
  * Implement proper authentication token handling (secure storage, expiration, rotation)
  * Enable security headers (HSTS, X-Content-Type-Options, X-Frame-Options)
  * Configure Content Security Policy
  * Add rate limiting to prevent brute force attacks
  * Ensure sensitive data is encrypted at rest and in transit
  * Remove or secure any exposed debugging endpoints

- Verification:
  * Re-scan for vulnerabilities after fixes
  * Test authentication flows for bypass attempts
  * Verify all high and critical issues are resolved
  * Document remaining accepted risks if any
